abstract.p: Informix Corp account goes to San Francisco office of Young & Rubicam Advertising; Conde Nast Publications account for Lucky magazine goes to Black Rocket agency; Coventry Health Care account goes to Gray Kirk/VanSant Advertising and Public Relations (S)

block.p: * Informix Corp., Menlo Park, Calif., which offers software infrastructure services for the Internet, to the San Francisco office of Young & Rubicam Advertising, to handle its account, which had been inactive. Billings were estimated at $40 million. * Conde Nast Publications, New York, part of Advance Publications, to Black Rocket, San Francisco, to handle the introduction of Lucky, a magazine about shopping that recently published an initial issue. Spending was estimated at $8 million to $10 million. * Coventry Health Care, Bethesda, Md., to Gray, Kirk/VanSant Advertising and Public Relations, Baltimore, to handle its account, which had been at Earle Palmer Brown, Philadelphia, part of EPB Communications. Billings were estimated at $5 million to $7 million.
